Introduction.Japanese: 羽黒です。妙高型重巡洋艦姉妹の末っ娘です。あ、あの…ごめんなさいっ！
Introduction.English: I'm Haguro. I'm the youngest of the Myoukou-class heavy cruiser sisters. U-um... I'm sorry!
Introduction.Note: Haguro was actually the third of the Myoukou-class cruisers. The youngest would be Ashigara, as she was laid down, launched and commissioned later than Haguro was.

Introduction.Japanese: 妙高型重巡洋艦、羽黒です。皆さんと共に、全力で戦線を支えますっ！
Introduction.English: Fourth ship of the Myoukou-class heavy cruisers, Haguro. Together with everyone, I will support the front lines!

Library.Japanese: 長崎で生まれたの。スラバヤ沖海戦、珊瑚海海戦、ミッドウェー海戦、第二次ソロモン海戦、マリアナ海戦など数々の海戦に参加しました。あの…頑張ります！
Library.English: I was born in Nagasaki. I participated in many battles, in the Battle of the Java Sea, the Battle of the Coral Sea, the Battle of Midway, the Battle of the Eastern Solomons, and the Battle of the Philippine Sea. Um... I try my best!

Secretary 2.Japanese: し…司令官さん？…ごめんなさい！
司令官さん?…大丈夫、行けます！
Secretary 2.English: Commander? ... It's all right, I'm good!

Secretary 3.Japanese: あの…すみません…それは何か新しいコミュニケーションなのでしょうか…
Secretary 3.English: Um... excuse me... Is this some new way of communication?

Idle.Japanese: あ、あの…司令官…さん？羽黒、一応ここで待っています、ね？
Idle.English: E, excuse me, commander…? Haguro is waiting for you here in case of trouble...

Secretary Married.Japanese: 司令官さん…いつか戦いが終わって静かな海になるといいですね。私、祈っています。司令官さんならきっと…
Secretary Married.English: Commander… I hope this war will be over and the sea will get quiet. I pray for it. Commander… you will surely…

Wedding.Japanese: この戦いが終わったら…し、司令官さんと一緒に…！あの…あ、あのあの！
Wedding.English: After this battle is over… T-together with the Commander..! Erm.. Ummm.. Errrmm…
Wedding.Note: Marriage after the war is over death flag.

Looking At Scores.Japanese: あ…お知らせが届いたって…

Joining A Fleet.Japanese: こんな私ですが…精一杯頑張りますね！
Joining A Fleet.English: Picking even me... I'll try my absolute best!

Joining A Fleet.Japanese: 第五戦隊,羽黑，出撃します！
Joining A Fleet.English: Haguro of The Fifth Squadron, heading out!

Equipment 1.Japanese: 私なんて…強化していただかなくても…
Equipment 1.English: I... don't need to receive this kind of strength...

Equipment 1.Japanese: 頂いた装備、大切に使います。
Equipment 1.English: I will cherish the equipment I've received.

Equipment 2.Japanese: あの…他の人を改造してあげて？
Equipment 2.English: Um... could you remodel the others too?

Equipment 2.Japanese: 他の子の改装を…優先してください。
Equipment 2.English: Please remodel... the other girls first.

Equipment 3.Note: ⇧ shared with expedition selection, resource collection, instant repair and development

Supply.Japanese: 私なんて、強化していただかなくても…
Supply.English: I... don't need to receive this kind of strength...
I… I'm receiving it, thank you.

Docking Minor.English: The other girls (ships) should go first.

Docking Major.Japanese: はい、もう少しで轟沈するところでした…
Docking Major.English: Okay. Any more and I would have sunk instantly back there.

Docking Complete.Japanese: あの…艦の修理が、完了してた。
Docking Complete.English: Um... The ship repair.. has been finished.

Construction.Japanese: 新しい仲間が進水されたみたいです
Construction.English: It seems a new comrade has been launched.

Returning From Sortie.Japanese: 作戦完了って…あの…報告が…
Returning From Sortie.English: The battle is complete... Um... Just reporting...

Starting A Sortie.Japanese: あなた達の背中は私が守ります！

Battle Start.Japanese: 撃ち方、始めてくださーい！

Attack.Japanese: 砲雷撃戦って、これでいいのかしら…
Attack.English: Guns and torpedoes engaged, I hope this is enough...

Attack.Japanese: 五倍の相手だって･･･支えて見せます！
Attack.English: Even if there are five times the enemies...I will fight them all!
Attack.Note: Referring to the Battle of the Malacca Strait, also known as the Sinking of the Haguro. She fought five British destroyers by herself.

Night Battle.Japanese: これ以上やらせません！

MVP.Japanese: このまま、全ての戦いが終わってしまえばいいのに
MVP.English: As it is, it would be better if all the fighting could end.

Minor Damage 2.Japanese: 被弾…二番砲塔!?…まだ行けます！
Minor Damage 2.English: I'm hit...second turret!?...I can still continue!
Minor Damage 2.Note: Referring to the Battle of Leyte Gulf; her second turret was directly hit by US aircraft.

Major Damage.Japanese: ダメ…見ないで…見ないでぇー！

Sunk.Japanese: あの艦（コ）達、ちゃんと逃げ切れたかな…　ああ、もう何も、何も見えない…
Sunk.English: The other girls (ships), could they manage to hold on... Ah, no more, I can't see any more...
Sunk.Note: Referring to her last battle. She helped the destroyer Kamikaze leave the battlefield and continued fighting off the enemy. Kamikaze was the last Imperial Japan Naval destroyer that needed to flee the area. Kamikaze went on to fight against USS Hawkbill one-on-one.

White Day 2015.Japanese: ん？　この可愛らしいクッキーを、私に！？　司令官さん…本当に、ありがとうございます！　ぐすっ、うぅ…
White Day 2015.English: Hmm? Are these lovely cookies for me!? Thank you so very much… Commander! *sniff*

2nd Anniversary.Japanese: 司令官さん、二周年ですね、本当に…ありがとうございます！羽黒も、嬉しいです！
2nd Anniversary.English: It’s the 2nd anniversary, Commander. Thank you… so very much! I’m having fun too!

Midsummer 2015.Japanese: 夏ですね。…えぇ？ 泳がないのか、って？だって、水着とかないし…あ、あの…え、えええっ！？
Midsummer 2015.English: It’s summer. …Eh? Aren’t I going to swim? I mean, I don’t have a swimsuit… Uh-umm… E-eeeeeh!?

Early Autumn 2015.Japanese: 秋は、静かですね。羽黒、この季節、好きなんです。司令官さんはどうですか？
Early Autumn 2015.English: Autumn is peaceful. I like this season. What about you, Commander?

Christmas 2015.Japanese: 司令官さん、メリークリスマス！あ、あの…プレゼントもしよかったら…あの…
Christmas 2015.English: Merry Christmas, Commander! Uh-umm… If you don’t mind, here’s a present… Umm…

New Year 2016.Japanese: 新年、明けましておめでとうございます。今年もどうぞ…よろしく…お願いします！
New Year 2016.English: Happy New Year. Please… take care of me… this year too!

Setsubun 2016.Japanese: 司令官さん、節分ですね。あの…羽黒が鬼役をしましょうか？…えぇ、それは…
Setsubun 2016.English: It’s Setsubun, Commander. Umm… Shall I play the Oni? …Eh, that’s…

Valentine’s Day 2016.Japanese: あの、司令官さん、このチョコレート…よかったら受け取ってください。
Valentine’s Day 2016.English: Ummm, please accept these chocolates… if you don’t mind, Commander.

3rd Anniversary.Japanese: し、司令官さん、今日は記念日ですね。羽黒も本当に嬉しい… 嬉しいです！はい！
3rd Anniversary.English: T-today is an anniversary, Commander. I’m really happy… I’m having fun! Yes!
